thread.title: British Bunnings Warehouse ad on the nose for Aussie viewers - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: British Bunnings Warehouse ad on the nose for Aussie viewers - Yahoo7

author: News On February
title: British Bunnings Warehouse ad on the nose for Aussie viewers - Yahoo7
text:
Share British Bunnings Warehouse ad on the nose for Aussie viewers - Yahoo7 You’ll recognise the happy jingle, but it’s the British accents that might stop you dead in your tracks. Close ‘It’s a massive no’: Aussie’s angry over British Bunnings advert rip-off UP NEXT VIDEO ‘It’s a massive no’: Aussie’s angry over British Bunnings advert rip-off ‘It’s a massive no’: Aussie’s angry over British Bunnings advert rip-off 
Some Aussies are less than impressed that the Bunnings ad for the opening of it’s first UK hardware store replicates the Australian version. 
The trademark ‘Aussie-as’ style ad still features store workers dressed in their casual uniform inside the giant store, however it’s when viewers hear the catch-line, “where lowest prices are just the beginning” is when the trouble begins. The exterior shots show a gloomy UK backdrop. Source: Bunnings 
The staff are all British and apparently it’s rather off-putting. 
“The UK’s been waiting for something like this for so long,” says a staff member sporting the infamous green apron and red shirt. 
Furious Aussies have taken to social media to express their outrage at the seeming rip-off of what has now become a staple in the Australian advertising landscape. Do you recognise this guy? He's a British Bunnings worker. Source: Bunnings This viewer voted a big no. Source: Twitter 
Some have said the advert is “off-key”, while others has said the British accents “just sounded wrong”. 
“UK Bunnings advert is like listening to someone do a cover of your favourite song but just a little off-key,” wrote one woman. 
RELATED LINKS: Foreign comedian praises great Aussie tradition of the Bunnings sausage sizzle 
“If you take all of the sexual content out of the Fifty Shades of Gray (sic) movie, you're left with a Bunnings ad,” added another. 
The advert features five Bunnings employees explaining exactly what the store is and how it will help the lives of everyday UK customers. Bunnings is now in the UK. Brittish accents on a Bunnings ad just isn't right... https://t.co/3B4mSTFOyB — Addicted 2 Overwatch (@dix0nm8) February 13, 2017 
The logo is the same, the interior of the store is also identical, but critics feel copying and pasting the Australian version of the ad is too simplistic an approach. What's next? The sacred sizzle of a Bunnings sausage? Source: 7 News Close Bunnings set to open smaller stores in Australian shopping centres UP NEXT VIDEO Having won the war against Masters, Bunnings is now looking to conquer more traditional territory - small hardware stores. Bunnings set to open smaller stores in Australian shopping centres 
The ad signs off with the familiar “Bunnings Warehouse!” chorus, but with a strong English twang. 
Earlier in the year Bunnings' first British Saturday sausage sizzle was much hyped despite it occuring in the middle of a brutal winter where temperatures were freezing on the day. 
Bunnings said it planned to invest up to $831 million (£500 million) rolling out the Bunnings Warehouse format in the UK and Ireland over the next three years. 
The only question now is what will an Irish Bunnings ad sound like? 
Newsbreak – February 14
